about.more_info_en:
Score interpretation:

PIAMA Risk Score Risk of Asthma by School Age
≤7 ≤5%
8-15 6%-22%
≥16 25%-60%

Original/Primary Reference.text: Brunekreef B, et al. The prevention and incidence of asthma and mite allergy (PIAMA) birth cohort study: design and first results. Pediatr Allergy Immunol. 2002; 13: 55–60.

Validation.text: Hafkamp-de Groen E, et al. Predicting asthma in preschool children with asthma-like symptoms: validating and updating the PIAMA risk score. J Allergy Clin Immunol. 2013 Dec;132(6):1303-10. doi: 10.1016/j.jaci.2013.07.007. Epub 2013 Aug 26.

creator_info.about_en: Bert Brunekreef, PhD, is a professor of epidemiology at Utrecht University in the Netherlands, where he is currently the director of the Institute for Risk Assessment Sciences. Dr. Brunekreef is co-author of more than 500 peer reviewed journal articles in the field of environmental epidemiology and exposure assessment.

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en:
• The Prevention and Incidence of Asthma and Mite Allergy (PIAMA) Risk Score provides a method for predicting likelihood of a later asthma diagnosis.
  • The PIAMA Score's predictive ability depends heavily on prevalence of asthma in the general population.
how_to_use.why_use_en: A standardized score for determining which children are at higher risk for development of asthma may improve care and/or disease detection.

next_steps.advice_en: The PIAMA Score has moderate predictive success, and low scores seem more accurate at predicting when a child is unlikely to develop asthma.
